trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Windows Universal Apps
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Windows Universal Apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with analytics and push notifications for Windows Universal Apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with analytics and push notifications for Windows Universal Apps.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Windows Universal Apps
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Windows Universal Apps

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone Silverlight
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone Silverlight

trans-unit.source: iOS | Obj C
trans-unit.target: iOS | Obj C

trans-unit.source: iOS | Swift
trans-unit.target: iOS | Swift

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: Cordova
trans-unit.target: Cordova

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users of a Windows Universal application.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users of a Windows Universal application.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario using Mobile Engagement.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario using Mobile Engagement.

trans-unit.source: You will create a blank Windows Universal App that collects basic app usage data and receives push notifications using Windows Notification Service (WNS).
trans-unit.target: You will create a blank Windows Universal App that collects basic app usage data and receives push notifications using Windows Notification Service (WNS).

trans-unit.source: When you have completed this tutorial, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the devices or target-specific users based on their devices properties.
trans-unit.target: When you have completed this tutorial, you will be able to broadcast push notifications to all the devices or target-specific users based on their devices properties.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Mobile Engagement to address specific users and groups of devices.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Mobile Engagement to address specific users and groups of devices.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.source: The [Mobile Engagement Windows Universal SDK]
trans-unit.target: The [Mobile Engagement Windows Universal SDK]

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for Windows Universal Apps.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Engagement tutorials for Windows Universal Apps.

trans-unit.source: To complete it - you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete it - you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: Set up Mobile Engagement for your Windows Universal App
trans-unit.target: Set up Mobile Engagement for your Windows Universal App

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure portal, and then click **+NEW** at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure portal, and then click **+NEW** at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Services**, click **Mobile Engagement**, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Services**, click **Mobile Engagement**, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up that appears, enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up that appears, enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Application Name**: Type the name of your application.
trans-unit.target: **Application Name**: Type the name of your application.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to use any character.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to use any character.

trans-unit.source: **Platform**: Select the target platform (**Windows Universal**) for the app (if your app targets multiple platforms, repeat this tutorial for each platform).
trans-unit.target: **Platform**: Select the target platform (**Windows Universal**) for the app (if your app targets multiple platforms, repeat this tutorial for each platform).

trans-unit.source: **Application Resource Name**: This is the name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.
trans-unit.target: **Application Resource Name**: This is the name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.

trans-unit.source: You must only use conventional URL characters.
trans-unit.target: You must only use conventional URL characters.

trans-unit.source: The auto-generated name should provide you a strong basis.
trans-unit.target: The auto-generated name should provide you a strong basis.

trans-unit.source: You should also append the platform name to avoid any name clash because this name must be unique.
trans-unit.target: You should also append the platform name to avoid any name clash because this name must be unique.

trans-unit.source: **Location**: Select the datacenter where this app (and more importantly its Collection) will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: **Location**: Select the datacenter where this app (and more importantly its Collection) will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: **Collection**: If you have already created an application, select a previously created Collection, otherwise select **New Collection**.
trans-unit.target: **Collection**: If you have already created an application, select a previously created Collection, otherwise select **New Collection**.

trans-unit.source: **Collection Name**: This represents your group of applications.
trans-unit.target: **Collection Name**: This represents your group of applications.

trans-unit.source: It also ensures that all your apps are in a group that allows aggregated calculations of metrics.
trans-unit.target: It also ensures that all your apps are in a group that allows aggregated calculations of metrics.

trans-unit.source: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.
trans-unit.target: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] If your Universal App is going to target both Windows and Windows Phone platforms, you should still create two Mobile Engagement applications, one for each supported platforms.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] If your Universal App is going to target both Windows and Windows Phone platforms, you should still create two Mobile Engagement applications, one for each supported platforms.

trans-unit.source: This is to ensure that you are able to create correct segmentation of the audience and are able to send appropriately targeted notifications for each platform.
trans-unit.target: This is to ensure that you are able to create correct segmentation of the audience and are able to send appropriately targeted notifications for each platform.

trans-unit.source: Select the app that you just created in the **Applications** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the app that you just created in the **Applications** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connection Info** in order to display the **Connection** settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connection Info** in order to display the **Connection** settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Connection String** - this is what you will need to identify this app in your application code and to connect with Mobile Engagement from your Universal App.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Connection String** - this is what you will need to identify this app in your application code and to connect with Mobile Engagement from your Universal App.

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to the Mobile Engagement backend

trans-unit.source: This tutorial presents a "basic integration," which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial presents a "basic integration," which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.

trans-unit.source: The complete integration documentation can be found in the Mobile Engagement Windows Universal SDK documentation.
trans-unit.target: The complete integration documentation can be found in the Mobile Engagement Windows Universal SDK documentation.

trans-unit.source: We will create a basic app with Visual Studio to demonstrate the integration.
trans-unit.target: We will create a basic app with Visual Studio to demonstrate the integration.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Windows Universal App project
trans-unit.target: Create a new Windows Universal App project

trans-unit.source: You can skip this step if you already have an app and are familiar with Windows Universal development.
trans-unit.target: You can skip this step if you already have an app and are familiar with Windows Universal development.

trans-unit.source: Start Visual Studio, and in the **Home** screen, select **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: Start Visual Studio, and in the **Home** screen, select **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up, select **Store Apps** -> **Universal Apps** -> **Blank App (Universal Apps)**.
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up, select **Store Apps** -> **Universal Apps** -> **Blank App (Universal Apps)**.

trans-unit.source: Fill in the app **Name** and **Solution name**, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the app **Name** and **Solution name**, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: You have now created a new Windows Universal App project into which we will integrate the Azure Mobile Engagement SDK.
trans-unit.target: You have now created a new Windows Universal App project into which we will integrate the Azure Mobile Engagement SDK.

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to Mobile Engagement backend
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to Mobile Engagement backend

trans-unit.source: Install the [Mobile Engagement Windows Universal SDK] nuget package in your project.
trans-unit.target: Install the [Mobile Engagement Windows Universal SDK] nuget package in your project.

trans-unit.source: If you are targeting both Windows and Windows Phone platforms, you need to do this for both the projects.
trans-unit.target: If you are targeting both Windows and Windows Phone platforms, you need to do this for both the projects.

trans-unit.source: The same Nuget package places the correct platform-specific binaries in each project.
trans-unit.target: The same Nuget package places the correct platform-specific binaries in each project.

trans-unit.source: Open **Package.appxmanifest** and add the following if it isn't automatically added:
trans-unit.target: Open **Package.appxmanifest** and add the following if it isn't automatically added:

trans-unit.source: Now copy the connection string that you copied earlier for your Mobile Engagement App and paste it in the `Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml` file, between the `<connectionString>` and `</connectionString>` tags:
trans-unit.target: Now copy the connection string that you copied earlier for your Mobile Engagement App and paste it in the `Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml` file, between the `<connectionString>` and `</connectionString>` tags:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] If your App is going to target both Windows and Windows Phone platforms, you should still create two Mobile Engagement Applications - one for each supported platforms.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] If your App is going to target both Windows and Windows Phone platforms, you should still create two Mobile Engagement Applications - one for each supported platforms.

trans-unit.source: This is to ensure that you are able to create correct segmentation of the audience and are able to send appropriately targeted notifications for each platform.
trans-unit.target: This is to ensure that you are able to create correct segmentation of the audience and are able to send appropriately targeted notifications for each platform.

trans-unit.source: In the `App.xaml.cs` file:
trans-unit.target: In the `App.xaml.cs` file:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Add the `using` statement:
trans-unit.target: Add the `using` statement:

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Initialize the SDK in the **OnLaunched** method:
trans-unit.target: Initialize the SDK in the **OnLaunched** method:

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Insert the following in the **OnActivated** method and add the method if it is not already present:
trans-unit.target: Insert the following in the **OnActivated** method and add the method if it is not already present:

trans-unit.source: Enable real-time monitoring
trans-unit.target: Enable real-time monitoring

trans-unit.source: In order to start sending data and ensuring that the users are active, you must send at least one screen (Activity) to the Mobile Engagement backend.
trans-unit.target: In order to start sending data and ensuring that the users are active, you must send at least one screen (Activity) to the Mobile Engagement backend.

trans-unit.source: We achieve this by subclassing our **MainPage** with the **EngagementPage**, which the Mobile Engagement SDK provides.
trans-unit.target: We achieve this by subclassing our **MainPage** with the **EngagementPage**, which the Mobile Engagement SDK provides.

trans-unit.source: Add the `using` statement:
trans-unit.target: Add the `using` statement:

trans-unit.source: Replace the super class of **MainPage**, which is before **Page**, with **EngagementPage**:
trans-unit.target: Replace the super class of **MainPage**, which is before **Page**, with **EngagementPage**:

trans-unit.source: In your `MainPage.xml` file:
trans-unit.target: In your `MainPage.xml` file:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Add to your namespaces declarations:
trans-unit.target: Add to your namespaces declarations:

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Replace the **Page** in the XML tag name with **engagement:EngagementPage**.
trans-unit.target: Replace the **Page** in the XML tag name with **engagement:EngagementPage**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If your page overrides the `OnNavigatedTo` method, be sure to call `base.OnNavigatedTo(e)`.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If your page overrides the `OnNavigatedTo` method, be sure to call `base.OnNavigatedTo(e)`.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the activity will not be reported (the `EngagementPage` calls `StartActivity` inside its `OnNavigatedTo` method).
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the activity will not be reported (the `EngagementPage` calls `StartActivity` inside its `OnNavigatedTo` method).

trans-unit.source: This is especially important in a Windows Phone project where the default template has an `OnNavigatedTo` method.
trans-unit.target: This is especially important in a Windows Phone project where the default template has an `OnNavigatedTo` method.

trans-unit.source: Ensure your app is connected with real-time monitoring
trans-unit.target: Ensure your app is connected with real-time monitoring

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to make sure that your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using the Mobile Engagement's real-time monitoring feature.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to make sure that your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using the Mobile Engagement's real-time monitoring feature.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: From your Azure portal, ensure you're in the app we're using for this project, and then click the **Engage** button at the bottom.
trans-unit.target: From your Azure portal, ensure you're in the app we're using for this project, and then click the **Engage** button at the bottom.

trans-unit.source: You will land in the **Settings** page of your Engagement portal for your app.
trans-unit.target: You will land in the **Settings** page of your Engagement portal for your app.

trans-unit.source: From there, click the **Monitor** tab as shown below.
trans-unit.target: From there, click the **Monitor** tab as shown below.

trans-unit.source: The monitor is ready to show you any device, in real time, that will start your app.
trans-unit.target: The monitor is ready to show you any device, in real time, that will start your app.

trans-unit.source: Back in Visual Studio, start your app either in the emulator or in a connected device.
trans-unit.target: Back in Visual Studio, start your app either in the emulator or in a connected device.

trans-unit.source: If it worked, you should now see one session in the monitor in real time!
trans-unit.target: If it worked, you should now see one session in the monitor in real time!

trans-unit.source: **Congratulations!** You succeeded in completing the first step of this tutorial with an app that connects to the Mobile Engagement backend, which is already sending data.
trans-unit.target: **Congratulations!** You succeeded in completing the first step of this tutorial with an app that connects to the Mobile Engagement backend, which is already sending data.

trans-unit.source: Enable push notifications and in-app messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable push notifications and in-app messaging

trans-unit.source: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact and reach your users with push notifications and in-app messaging in the context of campaigns.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact and reach your users with push notifications and in-app messaging in the context of campaigns.

trans-unit.source: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: The following sections set up your app to receive them.
trans-unit.target: The following sections set up your app to receive them.

trans-unit.source: Enable your app to receive WNS Push Notifications
trans-unit.target: Enable your app to receive WNS Push Notifications

trans-unit.source: In the `Package.appxmanifest` file, in the **Application** tab, under **Notifications**, select **Yes** for **Toast capable:**:
trans-unit.target: In the `Package.appxmanifest` file, in the **Application** tab, under **Notifications**, select **Yes** for **Toast capable:**:

trans-unit.source: Initialize the REACH SDK
trans-unit.target: Initialize the REACH SDK

trans-unit.source: In `App.xaml.cs`, call **EngagementReach.Instance.Init();** in the **OnLaunched** function right after the agent initialization:
trans-unit.target: In `App.xaml.cs`, call **EngagementReach.Instance.Init();** in the **OnLaunched** function right after the agent initialization:

trans-unit.source: In `App.xaml.cs`, call **EngagementReach.Instance.Init(e);** in the **OnActivated** function right after the agent initialization:
trans-unit.target: In `App.xaml.cs`, call **EngagementReach.Instance.Init(e);** in the **OnActivated** function right after the agent initialization:

trans-unit.source: You're all set for sending a toast.
trans-unit.target: You're all set for sending a toast.

trans-unit.source: Now we will verify that you have correctly carried out this basic integration.
trans-unit.target: Now we will verify that you have correctly carried out this basic integration.

trans-unit.source: Grant access to Mobile Engagement to send notifications
trans-unit.target: Grant access to Mobile Engagement to send notifications

trans-unit.source: You'll have to associate your app with a Windows Store App to obtain your **Package security identifier (SID)** and your **Secret Key** (Client Secret).
trans-unit.target: You'll have to associate your app with a Windows Store App to obtain your **Package security identifier (SID)** and your **Secret Key** (Client Secret).

trans-unit.source: You can create an app from the [Windows Store Dev Center] and then make sure to use **Associate App with Store** from Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can create an app from the [Windows Store Dev Center] and then make sure to use **Associate App with Store** from Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **Settings** of your Mobile Engagement portal, and click the **Native Push** section on the left.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **Settings** of your Mobile Engagement portal, and click the **Native Push** section on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Edit** button to enter your **Package security identifier (SID)** and your **Secret Key** as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Click the **Edit** button to enter your **Package security identifier (SID)** and your **Secret Key** as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Send a notification to your app
trans-unit.target: Send a notification to your app

trans-unit.source: We will now create a simple push notification campaign that sends a push notification to our app.
trans-unit.target: We will now create a simple push notification campaign that sends a push notification to our app.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **REACH** tab in your Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **REACH** tab in your Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **New announcement** to create your push notification campaign.
trans-unit.target: Click **New announcement** to create your push notification campaign.

trans-unit.source: Set up the first field of your campaign through the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Set up the first field of your campaign through the following steps:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Name your campaign.
trans-unit.target: Name your campaign.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Select **Delivery time** as *Any time* to allow the app to receive a notification whether the app is started or not.
trans-unit.target: Select **Delivery time** as *Any time* to allow the app to receive a notification whether the app is started or not.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: In the notification text - type the **Title** which will be in bold in the push.
trans-unit.target: In the notification text - type the **Title** which will be in bold in the push.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: Then type your message.
trans-unit.target: Then type your message.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down, and in the **Content** section, select **Notification only**.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down, and in the **Content** section, select **Notification only**.

trans-unit.source: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible.
trans-unit.target: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible.

trans-unit.source: Now scroll down again and click the **Create** button to save your campaign.
trans-unit.target: Now scroll down again and click the **Create** button to save your campaign.

trans-unit.source: Last step: Click **Activate** to activate your campaign and to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Last step: Click **Activate** to activate your campaign and to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: You should now see a toast notification from your campaign on your device - the app should be closed to see this toast notification.
trans-unit.target: You should now see a toast notification from your campaign on your device - the app should be closed to see this toast notification.

trans-unit.source: If the app was running, ensure that you have it closed for a couple of minutes before activating the campaign to be able to receive toast notification.
trans-unit.target: If the app was running, ensure that you have it closed for a couple of minutes before activating the campaign to be able to receive toast notification.

trans-unit.source: If you want to integrate in-app notification so that the notification shows up in the app when it is opened, see [Windows Universal Apps - Overlay integration].
trans-unit.target: If you want to integrate in-app notification so that the notification shows up in the app when it is opened, see [Windows Universal Apps - Overlay integration].

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
